Patch Set 11:

(1 comment)
Maybe leave off this comment, since if some commit ever changes it in PDI it would be outdated here.
Done
could even simplify this to a one liner:  return util::SDBusPlus:: ...
Done

I tried to build with this and it failed with:
ERROR: 'Can not set values on configuration object that has been used.'

So this block would need to go up above line 155.
Sorry, I was careless to test this by configuring #define USE_IBM_COMPATIBLE_SYSTEM directly to the file so I wasn't aware. Updated.
After I moved it up, I built and tried all 3 applications, and while fan-monitor got its config, fan-control never loaded a config file.  (not sure about fan-presence yet)
That worked better, thanks.
I can't think of a case where we'd need to fallback to the PrettyName since we've already selected the IBMCompatible interface to be used.

Is it unlikely that the IBMCompatible interface can't be found on DBus? That's just my thought that the Inventory.Item interface is the last effort to look for the configs so I always have it prepared to be used when the former one fails. That explains why I didn't put it in an #else. I wonder if the IBM's inf was to be really not on DBus, would we wait for an InterfaceAdded signal forever? At lease we try the generic interface once?

Yea, we would wait forever, well, until power on when fan monitor checks if it has a config loaded and throws if it doesn't.

I don't think there's a need to try the generic one, we support 6 different configs in the flash image so far and haven't had an issue.
ACK. I have updated to support only one interface at a time. This reduces many code lines compared to my last patch set. Please help check it out.
Done
`both interface` -> `both interfaces`
Ack. I would update it in the next patch set.
We only process one interface at a time now so this will be singular.
I think you could wrap this in a #else since it isn't needed if 161 is true.
Done. Updated to only process one interface for one build image. Same as below.
Since the user already set the flag to use the IBMCompatible interface here, I don't think it needs to continue on. So you can also remove the try/catch around loadFunc above like you do below.
Done
like up above, I don't think it's necessary to try the Inventory.Item interface after this, could just wrap the prettyNameValsIt stuff below in an #else.
Done
Is this change really necessary?
It is not. But since I'm adding more variables and codes, I want to make it look less cumbersome. Is it ok to place them in the same commit? I think it's small to separate.
I don't feel strongly enough to ask you to put it into a separate commit, or to reject the change, so it's fine.
Done

Did you change these lines on purpose? The author had a commit where this was put in place for a purpose, so I'd be hesitant to change it.

Also, the loadFunc in the else leg was removed, which I think we still need.

The loadFunc was called in both cases of (objPaths.empty()?), just that when the configs are not found, it won't throw when the property value vector is empty, and will probably throw on the other hand. However, IBMCompatibleSystem inf is unique, but the Iventory.Item is not. If there's a list of obj paths implementing the Inventory.Item interface but the configs can't still be found, there's a chance the desired object path has not been up on DBus yet. So I just let it catch the throw anyway. What do you think here? I can just add an #ifdef to separate 2 interface behavior.

Thanks for the explanation, makes sense.
Yea, I think I'd prefer just using #ifdefs to keep it how it was for the IBM case.
Thank you. Done.

Looks good to me.
Before merging, I'd like to get a commit up in the meta-ibm layer to add the new meson option to the p10bmc machines so it still works.

Thanks. As Inventory.Item interface needs to be added to EM configuration to provide for the generic interface case of this patch. I just pushed a patch in EM to add the interface to the global schema and add properties to its definition in openbmc-dbus schema: https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/entity-manager/+/66981. I suspect the legitimation of that patch because openbmc-dbus schema only defines more definitions down the tree under Inventory/Item such as Board, Chassis,... I don't know if I can make Inventory/Item as "type":"object" and add properties to it. Can you please help check a bit.

I tested this out using the Decorator.Compatible interface in our EM config, and it worked well.

In fact it worked well enough that that I can't think of a reason to use the IBMCompatible one at all.

So while I could do a follow up a commit to just remove the IBMCompatible stuff, it might save work if you just ripped out that support from this commit, which would just be removing the ifdefs.

I would need to get the commits into EM to add the new iface on our chassis files, and also rename our config files directories to match the new com.ibm.Hardware value in the Names property.

However, we aren't building master directly at this time so if this one went in first I don't think anyone would notice.

What do you think?

If it's clear that this one is going in the right direction, I really don't mind it being merged now or later. And I think it's better to take actions in IBM side first like you said, as it can straighten many things out (about the format of the Names value as Patrick seems to intend to change it to better fit reality,...).

I will need to remove the ifdefs in the code body, the build options and the "xyz.openbmc_project.Configuration.IBMCompatibleSystem" interface anywhere defined, right?

Yep, that's right.

I have two commits up so far at 
https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/entity-manager/+/68128
https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/phosphor-dbus-interfaces/+/68125

and then I just need to do one more to move the fan config files.
Done. Thank you.
why did you change this away from getSubTreePaths?  you're passing in the interface, so the mapper will only return paths that have that interface.

Because getSubTreeRaw will provide me with the service name which I need in order to know that it is from Entity-Manager. The interface Decorator.Compatible can also be exposed by bmc-code-mgmt under an image obj path with a list of compatible system strings that the image support. I don't want these to be used as they causes parsing the wrong config set.
ah, missed that. Thanks.
I put up my corresponding change at https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/phosphor-fan-presence/+/68236.  After my team reviews it these can both go.
Yes, thanks a lot. I really appreciate the help you offered.
was this just left over from the previous change set?  may as well remove it
Yes. Removed.
